summary: The 'Due Process Continuity of Care Act' (HR 1510) amends Title XIX of the Social Security Act to eliminate the Medicaid coverage exclusion for inmates awaiting disposition of charges. It mandates planning grants to states to support providing medical assistance to these individuals, focusing on provider recruitment, infrastructure development, and quality-of-care assurance. The bill aims to ensure continuity of healthcare access for incarcerated individuals, promoting services like substance use disorder treatment and behavioral health services, and includes effective date provisions and definitions related to the Medicaid program.
